info.title: Order Risk
info.description:
The Order Risk resource allows you to create, retrieve, update, and delete order risks. Order risks represent the results of fraud checks that have been completed for an order.

Usage notes

  • When determining an order's risk level, Shopify takes into account only those order risks that have the display property set to true. Orders with a display set to false will not be returned through the Order Risk resource. It's not advised to create order risks with a display set to false. This property might be removed in future API versions.
  • Risk assessments will favor the most severe risk recommendation for an order. Keep this in mind when creating new order risks.

paths.description: Creates an order risk for an order
paths.summary: Creates an order risk for an order

201.description: Creates an order risk for an order

risk.message: This order came from an anonymous proxy
risk.merchant_message: This order came from an anonymous proxy

response.body: {"risk":{"id":1029151490,"order_id":450789469,"checkout_id":901414060,"source":"External","score":"1.0","recommendation":"cancel","display":true,"cause_cancel":true,"message":"This order came from an anonymous proxy","merchant_message":"This order came from an anonymous proxy"}}

x-examples.name: Create an order risk showing a fraud risk for proxy detection

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"risk":{"message":"This order came from an anonymous proxy","recommendation":"cancel","score":"1.0","source":"External","cause_cancel":true,"display":true}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2023-04/orders/450789469/risks.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

order_risk = ShopifyAPI::OrderRisk.new(session: test_session)
order_risk.order_id = 450789469
order_risk.message = "This order came from an anonymous proxy"
order_risk.recommendation = "cancel"
order_risk.score = "1.0"
order_risk.source = "External"
order_risk.cause_cancel = true
order_risk.display = true
order_risk.save!

paths.description: Retrieves a list of all order risks for an order. Note: As of version 2019-10, this endpoint implements pagination by using links that are provided in the response header. Sending the page parameter will return an error. To learn more, see Make paginated requests to the REST Admin API.
paths.summary: Retrieves a list of all order risks for an order

200.description: Retrieves a list of all order risks for an order

risks.message: This order was placed from a proxy IP
risks.merchant_message: This order was placed from a proxy IP

risks.message: This order came from an anonymous proxy
risks.merchant_message: This order came from an anonymous proxy

response.body: {"risks":[{"id":284138680,"order_id":450789469,"checkout_id":null,"source":"External","score":"1.0","recommendation":"cancel","display":true,"cause_cancel":true,"message":"This order was placed from a proxy IP","merchant_message":"This order was placed from a proxy IP"},{"id":1029151489,"order_id":450789469,"checkout_id":901414060,"source":"External","score":"1.0","recommendation":"cancel","display":true,"cause_cancel":true,"message":"This order came from an anonymous proxy","merchant_message":"This order came from an anonymous proxy"}]}

x-examples.name: Retrieve all order risks for an order

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2023-04/orders/450789469/risks.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::OrderRisk.all(
  session: test_session,
  order_id: 450789469,
)

risk.message: This order was placed from a proxy IP
risk.merchant_message: This order was placed from a proxy IP

response.body: {"risk":{"id":284138680,"order_id":450789469,"checkout_id":null,"source":"External","score":"1.0","recommendation":"cancel","display":true,"cause_cancel":true,"message":"This order was placed from a proxy IP","merchant_message":"This order was placed from a proxy IP"}}

curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2023-04/orders/450789469/risks/284138680.json" \

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(

paths.description:
Updates an order risk


Note

You cannot modify an order risk that was created by another application.

risk.message: After further review, this is a legitimate order
risk.merchant_message: After further review, this is a legitimate order

request.body: {"risk":{"id":284138680,"message":"After further review, this is a legitimate order","recommendation":"accept","source":"External","cause_cancel":false,"score":"0.0"}}

response.body: {"risk":{"order_id":450789469,"cause_cancel":false,"message":"After further review, this is a legitimate order","recommendation":"accept","score":"0.0","source":"External","id":284138680,"checkout_id":null,"display":true,"merchant_message":"After further review, this is a legitimate order"}}

x-examples.name: Update an existing order risk for an order

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"risk":{"id":284138680,"message":"After further review, this is a legitimate order","recommendation":"accept","source":"External","cause_cancel":false,"score":"0.0"}}' \
-X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2023-04/orders/450789469/risks/284138680.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

order_risk = ShopifyAPI::OrderRisk.new(session: test_session)
order_risk.order_id = 450789469
order_risk.id = 284138680
order_risk.message = "After further review, this is a legitimate order"
order_risk.recommendation = "accept"
order_risk.source = "External"
order_risk.cause_cancel = false
order_risk.score = "0.0"
order_risk.save!

paths.description:
Deletes an order risk for an order


Note

You cannot delete an order risk that was created by another application.
paths.summary: Deletes an order risk for an order

200.description: Deletes an order risk for an order

x-examples.name: Delete an order risk for an order

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X DELETE "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2023-04/orders/450789469/risks/284138680.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::OrderRisk.delete(
  session: test_session,
  order_id: 450789469,
  id: 284138680,
)

properties.description:
Whether this order risk is severe enough to force the cancellation of the order. If true, then this order risk is included in the Order canceled message that's shown on the details page of the canceled order.

Note: Setting this property to true does not cancel the order. Use this property only if your app automatically cancels the order using the Order resource. If your app doesn't automatically cancel orders based on order risks, then leave this property set to false.
properties.name: cause_cancel

properties.description: The ID of the checkout that the order risk belongs to.
properties.name: checkout_id

properties.description:
Whether the order risk is displayed on the order details page in the Shopify admin. If false, then this order risk is ignored when Shopify determines your app's overall risk level for the order.

It's not advised to create order risks with a display set to false.

This property can't be changed after an order risk is created.

This property might be removed in future API versions.
properties.name: display

properties.description: A unique numeric identifier for the order risk.
properties.name: id

properties.description: The message that's displayed to the merchant to indicate the results of the fraud check. The message is displayed only if display is set totrue.
properties.example: This order came from an anonymous proxy.
properties.name: merchant_message

properties.description: The message that's displayed to the merchant to indicate the results of the fraud check. The message is displayed only if display is set totrue.
properties.example: This order came from an anonymous proxy.
properties.name: message

properties.description: The ID of the order that the order risk belongs to.
properties.name: order_id

properties.description:
The recommended action given to the merchant. Valid values:
  • cancel: There is a high level of risk that this order is fraudulent. The merchant should cancel the order.
  • investigate: There is a medium level of risk that this order is fraudulent. The merchant should investigate the order.
  • accept: There is a low level of risk that this order is fraudulent. The order risk found no indication of fraud.
properties.name: recommendation

properties.description:
For internal use only. A number between 0 and 1 that's assigned to the order. The closer the score is to 1, the more likely it is that the order is fraudulent.

Note

There is no guarantee of stability in risk scores. Scores are not probabilities. The relationship between scores and the probability of fraud can vary over time and between risk providers.
properties.name: score

properties.description: The source of the order risk.
properties.name: source

x-shopify-meta.meta_description: Display a fraud analysis and recommendations on the details page of an order.
